trans-unit.source: Represents an entry in either back or forward navigation history.

[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wpf](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-wpf-md.md)] implements a navigation history service that stores one entry for each piece of content that has been previously navigated to, just like navigation history in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ie](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-ie-md.md)].
Navigation history comprises two stacks, one that remembers back navigation history, and one that remembers forward navigation history.
An entry for the current item is added to back navigation history when a forward navigation occurs.

This occurs in the following situations: - The `Navigate` method is called (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.Navigate%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.Navigate%2A?displayProperty=fullName>).

- The `GoForward` method is called (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.GoForward%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.GoForward%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.GoForward%2A?displayProperty=fullName>).

- The forward button on the navigation [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] that is displayed from the current navigator ([!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xbap](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame>).

Likewise, an entry for the current item is added to forward navigation history before a back navigation occurs, which happens when: - The `GoBack` method is called (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.GoBack%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.GoBack%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.GoBack%2A?displayProperty=fullName>).

- The back button on the navigation [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] that is displayed from the current navigator ([!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xbap](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame>).
Each entry in back and forward navigation history is an instance of the JournalEntry class.

Each JournalEntry object encapsulates information about a particular navigation, including a name for the entry (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry.Name%2A>), whether the entry is kept alive (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry.KeepAlive%2A>) and the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] for the content that is navigated to (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry.Source%2A>).

You can retrieve all the JournalEntry objects in back navigation history by enumerating the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.BackStack%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.BackStack%2A?displayProperty=fullName> properties.

For forward navigation history, you can retrieve all the JournalEntry objects by enumerating the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.ForwardStack%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.ForwardStack%2A?displayProperty=fullName> properties.

If you need to remove the most recent JournalEntry object from back navigation history, to prevent navigation to it, for example, you can call the `RemoveBackEntry` method (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.RemoveBackEntry%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.RemoveBackEntry%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.RemoveBackEntry%2A?displayProperty=fullName>), which removes the JournalEntry object and returns a reference to it.
You cannot add JournalEntry objects to navigation history, however, because you can neither instantiate nor derive from JournalEntry, and because no type implements a member to do so.

However, you can add custom <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.CustomContentState> objects to back navigation history by calling the `AddBackEntry` method (<xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService.AddBackEntry%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.AddBackEntry%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame.AddBackEntry%2A>); <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationService> adds the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.CustomContentState> object to an internally-created JournalEntry object, which is then added to the back navigation history.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry"></xref> class.
The serialization information.
The streaming context.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.CustomContentState"></xref> object that is associated with this journal entry.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.CustomContentState"></xref> object that is associated with this journal entry.
If one is not associated, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> is returned.
Returns the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry.KeepAlive*> attached property of the journal entry for the specified element.
The element from which to get the attached property value.
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry.KeepAlive*> attached property of the journal entry for the specified element.
Gets the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry.Name*> attached property of the journal entry for the specified element.
The element from which to get the attached property value.
The <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry.Name*> attached property of the journal entry for the specified element.
Called when this object is serialized.
The data that is required to serialize the target object.
The streaming context.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry.KeepAlive*> attached property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the name of the journal entry.
The name of the journal entry.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry.Name*> attached property.
To be added.
Sets the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry.KeepAlive*> attached property of the specified element.
The element on which to set the attached property value.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to keep the journal entry in memory; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Sets the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.JournalEntry.Name*> attached property of the specified element.
The element on which to set the attached property value.
The name to be assigned to the attached property.
Gets or sets the URI of the content that was navigated to.
The URI of the content that was navigated to, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if no URI is associated with the entry.
